___PayloadCertificateUUID.description: UUID of the certificate payload containing an identity used as the client credential

___PayloadIdentifier.description: A unique identifier for the payload, dot-delimited.  Usually root PayloadIdentifier+subidentifier

___ServerAddress.description: Server address (may be IP address, hostname, or URL).

___BlacklistedURLs.description: Each entry contains a URL that will not be accessible.

___PayloadVersion.description: The version of the whole configuration profile.

___PermittedURLs.description:
Used only when AutoFilterEnabled is true. Otherwise, this field is ignored.
				Each entry contains a URL that is accessible whether the automatic filter allows access or not.

___AutoFilterEnabled.description:
Optional. If true, automatic filtering is enabled. This function evaluates each web page as it is
				loaded and attempts to identify and block content not suitable for children.
				The search algorithm is complex and may vary from release to release, but it is basically looking for
				adult language, i.e. swearing and sexually explicit language. The default value is false.

___PayloadType.description: The type of the payload, a reverse dns string

___UserDefinedName.description: A string which will be displayed for this filtering configuration.

___PayloadOrganization.description: This value describes the issuing organization of the profile, as displayed to the user

___PluginBundleID.description: The Bundle ID of the plugin that provides filtering service.

___FilterType.description: Type of filter, built-in or plug-in

___Organization.description: An Organization string that will be passed to the 3rd party plugin.

___WhitelistedBookmarks.description: Optional. If present, these URLs are added to the browser’s bookmarks, and the user is not allowed to visit any sites other than these. The number of these URLs should be limited to about 500.

___BookmarkPath.description:
Optional. The folder into which the bookmark should be added in Safari—/Interesting Topic Pages/Biology/, for example.
								If absent, the bookmark is added to the default bookmarks directory.
